meanings.definition: The act of expelling evil spirits from a person or place.
meanings.sent1: During the exorcism, the priest chanted prayers to drive away the evil spirits.
meanings.sent2: The exorcism took place in the old haunted house to cleanse it of any malevolent entities.
meanings.sent3: The exorcism turned into a comical scene when the evil spirit started tap dancing instead of leaving.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an exorcism, banishing all the negative energy from the room.
meanings.sent5: The exorcism was so intense, it felt like a powerful force pushing the darkness away.

meanings.definition: A ritual or ceremony performed to rid a person or place of evil spirits.
meanings.sent1: The exorcism involved burning sage and reciting ancient incantations to purify the house.
meanings.sent2: People gathered around the bonfire to witness the exorcism of the cursed artifact.
meanings.sent3: The exorcism turned into a festive event with music and dancing to drive out the evil spirits.
meanings.sent4: The exorcism was like a beacon of light in the darkness, dispelling all traces of malevolence.
meanings.sent5: The exorcism felt like a warm embrace, comforting the soul and banishing fear.
